TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr Sarı and PERSON , were born in DATE and DATE respectively . At the material time they lived in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , at TIME , the applicants were arrested and taken into police custody by officers of the GPE security police in connection with an investigation into the illegal organisation ORG Dev PERSON ( ORG Front – Revolutionary Way – Revolutionary Movement ) .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicants’ detention in police custody was extended , under LAW of PERSON no . CARDINAL ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , initially until DATE , on the authorisation of the public prosecutor at ORG , and subsequently until DATE ( inclusive ) by order of a judge of that court .

CARDINAL . Before the end of their police custody period , on DATE at TIME , the applicants were questioned by the public prosecutor . They were not brought before a judge until TIME , that is to say on DATE . The judge ordered PERSON to be released for the duration of the proceedings and remanded Mr Sarı in custody .

CARDINAL . By a bill of indictment of DATE , the public prosecutor committed the applicants to stand trial before ORG . He called for their conviction , under LAW , on a charge of belonging to an armed gang .
CARDINAL . Following a hearing on DATE before a trial court , PERSON was granted provisional release .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE , after reclassifying the offence , ORG found the applicants guilty of aiding and abetting an armed gang , an offence punishable under LAW . It sentenced them to DATE and QUANTITY months’ imprisonment each , and banned them from holding public office for DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicants appealed on points of law against that judgment .
CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE , ORG quashed the judgment on account of an erroneous classification of the offence .
CARDINAL . ORG , in a judgment of DATE , deferred its decision on the ORG case .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to section CARDINAL(a ) of PERSON no . CARDINAL on procedure in the national security courts , the offences provided for under LAW , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Criminal Code fall within the exclusive jurisdiction of those courts . At the material time , section CARDINAL of that PERSON provided that any person arrested in connection with CARDINAL of those offences had to be brought before a judge within TIME at the latest , or , if the offence was a joint one committed outside the region under emergency rule , within DATE , not including the time needed to convey the prisoner to the judge .

CARDINAL . The fourth paragraph of LAW provides that any person who has been arrested , or whose police custody period has been extended on the order of a public prosecutor , is entitled to challenge that measure before the appropriate judge with a view to securing his or her immediate release . Such an application may also be lodged by the person ’s lawyer , legal representative , close relatives or spouse .
The third paragraph of LAW , amended by PERSON no . CARDINAL of DATE , reads as follows :

“ After an arrest has been made , and upon a decision of the public prosecutor , [ the authorities ] shall promptly inform a relative , or other person designated by the arrested person , that he or she has been arrested or that his or her police custody period has been extended . ”
